title: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:

I know info about commander keen is on wikipedia, a wiki would provide more in depth info about it.

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
Well I'm getting one ready to go on shikadi.net (in fact it's ready to go now, pending a switch to a new provider) so there'll be at least one available soon...

I think it will be a useful place to store all the little things we discover on this forum - funny bugs in the games, level hints, modding info, etc.

Anyway, once it's up it'll be interesting to see what people put in it. I've prepopulated it with the basics (level info, monster/enemy names and pictures, that sort of thing) but as with all wikis it will rely a lot on community involvement.

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
Too specific a subject. A retro Wiki or something will do though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
I've been making one for a long time for now (read: I've wanted to do it but never really got it started).. Although my idea hasn't exactly been a wiki, but something that's only editable for me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img]

But on the other hand, a wiki would be great too. And even if there is one, it doesn't stop me doing my own plan true one day. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
I don't think it's too specific a subject - there's plenty of obscure info out there about the games, and having it all in the one place will make it easy to find.

Of course it won't be as big as something like the Wikipedia, but even a small wiki can be helpful if you're looking for something specific (or if you want to make sure you know everything about a certain topic!)

For the curious, here's a [img]http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/keenwiki.png[/img].

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
Not bad. And you could even put up information about the various Mods people have made and all that.

And about the various Keeners themselves.

I suggest putting the information from the "Keen encyclopedia" on spatang... into the wiki as well.

title: wait!
content: The ammo pickups give 8 ammo on Easy mode, making the "shoot, exit, and re-enter" strategy yield 12 shots total, instead of 9.

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I'm not sure about that. Wouldn't it be vanity?[hr][/quote]
Only if you would make it.

For example, if one would write "Shadow Master is the best moder ever and has chicks follow him down the street because he uses Axe." That might be vanity. But not if you would have a little bio about the person and links to things they made. You know like...

"Xkylyr Rauh is a Russian-mercenary international man of mystery. Raised by dogs he now serves as Mortimer's right hand man.

And lives in California. Has a Vorticon girlfriend. Which he pretends he doesn't have."

See, that would be stating facts. That is not vanity.

[quote]Quote:[hr]And to note, a Keen wiki is definitely not too specific a subject! There's so much to write about them that a wiki's really good option! I have a lot to write..

I kinda like the concept of wiki, but on the other hand I don't want people, even if majority of them agree on it, to make something different I want to have written another way, so it may be that I can't rest until I've made a wiki of my own or something. [hr][/quote]
That is true. There is a lot of Non-game information to put on there.

And if you don't want people to change what you wrote you could always put on the "Mr.Rush official seal of officialness." So you know... no one would dare change it.

title: Re: Commander Keen - Wiki
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Xkylyr Rauh is a Russian-mercenary international man of mystery. Raised by dogs he now serves as Mortimer's right hand man. And lives in California. Has a Vorticon girlfriend. Which he pretends he doesn't have.[hr][/quote]
Um, is that true Xky? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] I'd add:

"He's has made several level packs and mods, the most important mods are Keen X (XkyKeen1), Keen Null (XkyKeen2) and Keen Dash (XkyKeen3). A sequel to Keen X, Keen Y, was made by another modder known as Grelphy (see Grelphy). Xky's fourth mod, which is known only by its production name, XkyKeen4, is in progress since 2005."

[quote]Quote:[hr]Shadow Master is the best moder ever and has chicks follow him down the street because he uses Axe.[hr][/quote]
The fact is:

"Shadow Master is a new, ordinary Keener who makes standard quality mods, lives in Chile and is not popular at all amongst girls."

That's the actual fact.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]
Wow, it's fun for me to write biograhpies (NOTE: no autobiographies). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content:
[hr]Slugfest "Xkylyr Rauh is a Russian-mercenary international man of mystery. Raised by dogs he now serves as Mortimer's right hand man.

And lives in California. Has a Vorticon girlfriend. Which he pretends he doesn't have."
[hr]ROFL! That's gotta go in there somewhere.

I think a biography section of some sort would be great. Even if it's just a bit of info about their location, and links to their prods. Though, including every single Keener doesn't seem practical, especially since Keening isn't confined to the PCKF, so we'd have to have some sort of criteria.

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content:
0. Founders of Cerebral Cortex 314: All of them deserve a biography.
1. Keeners of the Public Commander Keen Forum: Keeners of the PCKF since its birth (including old ones that have never returned).
2. Keeners of the Keen: Modding forum: Keeners of K:M (including the great adurdin).
3. Keeners of other places (insert your name here).

Isn't it a good criteria?[hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content:
Allstories is correct there - everyone who creates an account gets their own userpage (which is of the form "User:Malvineous", so pick your username carefully.) When you look at the history of a page (to see who's edited it in the past), if you click on someone's name there you go to their userpage.

To help limit spam I've disabled anonymous edits, so you'll need to create an account before you can edit pages.

I don't know whether the contents of the Keencyclopaedia are on there yet, but I have gone through and added just about every creature, level, etc. to index pages so there's some kind of structure on there - hopefully this will make it clearer for everyone when the wiki goes live. These pages are mostly empty, so there's plenty of room for people to start contributing straight away.

And Xky's point about the ammo amount being different in easy mode is a perfect example of how the wiki could be used - if it was already live Xky would be free to go in and update that page with the new info [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

My current plans are for it to go live one or two weeks from now.

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content: Well, just to keep you all updated on progress - I uploaded everything to the new server yesterday and it seems to be working well.  All I have to do now is move a couple of things off the old server onto the new one and then "switch over", and once that happens everything will become accessible.  It should only take me a couple of days, so the KeenWiki is well on its way now.

title: w00t
content: This sounds nice - I'm looking forward to contributing stuff.

I really, truly, and honestly wish that Levelord had never written that fan-fiction involving me in such imaginary romance. I have no attraction to Vorticons. I have a girlfriend, we just celebrated 4 happy years together in November 2006. I am not from Russia, I've never been to Russia, and I'm not a mercenary.

I playfully chose the custom title "Mortimer's Right-Hand Man" long ago, because I enjoy the necessary-yet-expendable relationship that minions share with their masters, and Mortimer seems like the kind of employer who would offer health benefits--but then void the contract as soon as your death became apparent.

...Truthfully, though, I will say that if the above quoted "information" regarding my "Vorticon interest" was ever posted in a Wiki, playfully or otherwise, I would be very hurt. It's a joke I have a hard time taking lightly.

Also, I'm not a very significant contributer to the Keen community anymore, unfortunately. I had a good run, there, from 2002-2004, when I did XkyKeen1-3, but really, I haven't done much since then. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: hmmmmmm
content:
It seems that Slugfest is a long-time lurker that registered just a few weeks ago. Similar to my case (in which I'm a short-time lurker that registered half a year ago).

Anyway, Xky, you can't remove from my head the following:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Shadow Master wrote: "He (Xky) has made several level packs and mods, the most important mods are Keen X (XkyKeen1), Keen Null (XkyKeen2) and Keen Dash (XkyKeen3). A sequel to Keen X, Keen Y, was made by another modder known as Grelphy (see Grelphy). Xky's fourth mod, which is known only by its production name, XkyKeen4, is in progress since 2005."[hr][/quote]

Damnit, I forgot to write the most important fact:
"Xky's first mod, Keen X, is also the second Commander Keen mod ever created (the first being Yorphius II by KeenRush). Thus, he's been also one of the greatest influences in the modding community."

[quote]Quote:[hr]Xky wrote: It's a joke I have a hard time taking lightly.[hr][/quote]
You're not the only one, believe it or not...

[quote]Quote:[hr]Slugfest wrote: For example, if one would write "Shadow Master is the best moder ever and has chicks follow him down the street because he uses Axe." That might be vanity. [hr][/quote]
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Thank you for reminding me that I don't have a life. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

Me can't wait for that wiki to be finished, btw. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] ------------------

title: Re: ...
content:
Xky, I don't think anyone takes your "fanfic image" seriously - I've always found it quite fun and I certainly don't think any less of you for it (in fact, it makes me think more of you because stories like that aren't made up about just anyone.)

I can see it from your point of view, but I think you're taking it too personally - people are just teasing you about it because like it or not, you're one of the more famous people in the Keen community. Instead of being worried what people might think of you, you should be flattered that you've made such an impact in the community that people keep talking about you, even if it means a lighthearted joke here and there - it's all in good fun.

If you still really don't like that image and can't live with it, it's up to you to figure out some way of shaking it off. You'll have to come up with some other image and publicise it enough that people forget about the old one...

content:

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content:
Malvineous, awesome site.

How did you use media wiki to create the site.
I have downloaded it, but have little experience with php and server side goings on.

Can you offer any tips ? i would love to get a wiki up just for experimentation.

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content: Thanks - have a look at the installation guide for MediaWiki, that'll tell you everything you need to know.  If you don't already have a web server though you'll need to install PHP, a web server (like Apache) and a database server (like MySQL.)  If you've never done anything like this before there is a fairly steep learning curve...

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content:
is it possible/legal to edit the graphics and colors, so its different from wikipedia ?

or change the layout if one so desired ?

title: Re: With a wiki entry I stab at thee.
content: You can change the look of MediaWiki quite significantly. Have a look at the [url=http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Gallery_of_user_styles]list of user styles[/url], most of which are freely available for download. There is plenty of documentation on configuring MediaWiki at [url=http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki]MediaWiki.org[/url].
